intro: Rupicapnos ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous rock-rose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and evergreen, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Rupicapnos ambigua is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
